Method Detail

buildConfiguration

public static org.compass.core.config.CompassConfiguration buildConfiguration(java.lang.String compassName)
Build up the compass configuration instance according to the factory settings. After the building, all the factory settings will be clear.

Parameters:
compassName - the compass instance name which will be created by this configuration
Returns:
the compass instance

setAutoCommit

public static void setAutoCommit(boolean isAutoCommit)
Set the auto commit of connection on or off in Compass engine

Parameters:
isAutoCommit - true if it is auto committed; otherwise, choose false;

setCompassManagedMode

public static void setCompassManagedMode(boolean isCompassManagedMode)
Set the compass managed mode on or off in Compass engine. When working in a non managed environment, Compass will wrap the data source with a TransactionAwareDataSourceProxy, and will commit/rollback the Jdbc connection. When working within a managed environment, no wrapping will be performed, and Compass will let the external transaction manager to commit/rollback the connection.

Parameters:
isCompassManagedMode - set true if turn on the compass managed mode

setDisableSchemaOperations

public static void setDisableSchemaOperations(boolean isDisableSchemaOperations)
Set the schema operations are enable or not. User can rename the column in the index table if it set as true

Parameters:
isDisableSchemaOperations - true if the schema operations is enable; otherwise, choose false;

setDataSourceAsFileDirectoryStore

public static void setDataSourceAsFileDirectoryStore(java.lang.String path,
                                                     java.lang.String protocol)
Set the connection path and file protocol if user try to store the index tables as files.

Parameters:
path - the file directory location to store the index tables
protocol - the type of file system which could be file://, mmap:// or niofs://

setDataSourceAsJdbcDirectoryStore

public static void setDataSourceAsJdbcDirectoryStore(java.lang.String url,
                                                     java.lang.String databaseDriver,
                                                     java.lang.String userName,
                                                     java.lang.String password)
Set the JDBC connection parameters if user try to store the index tables in database.

Parameters:
url - the database connection link
databaseDriver - the JDBC driver of database
userName - the user name of database
password - the password of database

setDataSourceAsRAMDirectoryStore

public static void setDataSourceAsRAMDirectoryStore(java.lang.String path)
Set the connection path and file protocol if user try to store the index tables in memory.

Parameters:
path - the memory location to store the index tables
